001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import regexodus.Matcher;
004import regexodus.Pattern;
005import squidpony.StringKit;
006
007import java.io.Serializable;
008
009/**
010 * Class for emulating various traditional RPG-style dice rolls.
011 * Supports rolling multiple virtual dice of arbitrary size, summing all, the highest <i>n</i>, or the lowest <i>n</i>
012 * dice, treating dice as "exploding" as in some tabletop games (where the max result is rolled again and added),
013 * getting value from inside a range, and applying simple arithmetic modifiers to the result (like adding a number).
014 * Typically you'll want to use the {@link #roll(String)} method if you have a String like {@code "2d8+6"}, or the
015 * various other methods if you have int variables for things like "number of dice to roll" and "sides on each die."
016 * <br>
017 * Based on code from the Blacken library.
018 *
019 * @author yam655
020 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
021 * @author Tommy Ettinger
022 */
023public class Dice implements Serializable {
024
025    private static final long serialVersionUID = -488902743486431146L;
026
027    // The Creature.
028    private static final Matcher mat = Pattern.compile("\\s*(?:(?:(-?\\d+)?\\s*(?:([:><])\\s*(\\d+))?\\s*(?:([d:!])\\s*(\\d+))?)|([+/*-]))\\s*").matcher();
029    private static final Matcher mat2 = Pattern.compile("\\s*(?:({=op}[+/*-])?\\s*({=sn}-?\\d+)?\\s*(?:({=im}[:><])\\s*({=mn}\\d+))?\\s*(?:({=mm}[d:!])\\s*({=en}\\d+))?)\\s*").matcher();
030    private IRNG rng;
031    private transient IntVLA temp = new IntVLA(20);
032    /**
033     * Creates a new dice roller that uses a random RNG seed for an RNG that it owns.
034     */
035    public Dice() {
036        rng = new GWTRNG();
037    }
038
039    /**
040     * Creates a new dice roller that uses the given IRNG, which can be seeded before it's given here. The IRNG will be
041     * shared, not copied, so requesting a random number from the same IRNG in another place may change the value of the
042     * next die roll this makes, and dice rolls this makes will change the state of the shared IRNG.
043     * @param rng an IRNG, such as {@link RNG} or {@link GWTRNG}; will be shared (dice rolls will change the IRNG state outside here)
044     */
045    public Dice(IRNG rng)
046    {
047        this.rng = rng;
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Creates a new dice roller that will use its own RNG, seeded with the given seed.
052     * @param seed a long to use as a seed for a new RNG (can also be an int, short, or byte)
053     */
054    public Dice(long seed)
055    {
056        rng = new GWTRNG(seed);
057    }
058    /**
059     * Creates a new dice roller that will use its own RNG, seeded with the given seed.
060     * @param seed a String to use as a seed for a new RNG
061     */
062    public Dice(String seed)
063    {
064        rng = new GWTRNG(seed);
065    }
066    /**
067     * Sets the random number generator to be used.
068     *
069     * This method does not need to be called before using the methods of this
070     * class.
071     *
072     * @param rng the source of randomness
073     */
074    public void setRandom(IRNG rng) {
075        this.rng = rng;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * Rolls the given number of dice with the given number of sides and returns
080     * the total of the best n dice.
081     *
082     * @param n number of best dice to total
083     * @param dice total number of dice to roll
084     * @param sides number of sides on the dice
085     * @return sum of best n out of <em>dice</em><b>d</b><em>sides</em>
086     */
087    private int bestOf(int n, int dice, int sides) {
088        int rolls = Math.min(n, dice);
089        temp.clear();
090        for (int i = 0; i < dice; i++) {
091            temp.add(rollDice(1, sides));
092        }
093
094        return bestOf(rolls, temp);
095
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Rolls the given number of exploding dice with the given number of sides and returns
100     * the total of the best n dice (counting a die that explodes as one die).
101     *
102     * @param n number of best dice to total
103     * @param dice total number of dice to roll
104     * @param sides number of sides on the dice
105     * @return sum of best n out of <em>dice</em><b>d</b><em>sides</em>
106     */
107    private int bestOfExploding(int n, int dice, int sides) {
108        int rolls = Math.min(n, dice);
109        temp.clear();
110        for (int i = 0; i < dice; i++) {
111            temp.add(rollExplodingDice(1, sides));
112        }
113        return bestOf(rolls, temp);
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Rolls the given number of dice with the given number of sides and returns
118     * the total of the lowest n dice.
119     *
120     * @param n number of worst dice to total
121     * @param dice total number of dice to roll
122     * @param sides number of sides on the dice
123     * @return sum of worst n out of <em>dice</em><b>d</b><em>sides</em>
124     */
125    private int worstOf(int n, int dice, int sides) {
126        int rolls = Math.min(n, dice);
127        temp.clear();
128        for (int i = 0; i < dice; i++) {
129            temp.add(rollDice(1, sides));
130        }
131        return worstOf(rolls, temp);
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * Rolls the given number of exploding dice with the given number of sides and returns
136     * the total of the lowest n dice (counting a die that explodes as one die).
137     *
138     * @param n number of worst dice to total
139     * @param dice total number of dice to roll
140     * @param sides number of sides on the dice
141     * @return sum of worst n out of <em>dice</em><b>d</b><em>sides</em>
142     */
143    private int worstOfExploding(int n, int dice, int sides) {
144        int rolls = Math.min(n, dice);
145        temp.clear();
146        for (int i = 0; i < dice; i++) {
147            temp.add(rollExplodingDice(1, sides));
148        }
149        return worstOf(rolls, temp);
150    }
151
152    /**
153     * Totals the highest n numbers in the pool.
154     *
155     * @param n the number of dice to be totaled
156     * @param pool the dice to pick from
157     * @return the sum
158     */
159    private int bestOf(int n, IntVLA pool) {
160        int rolls = Math.min(n, pool.size);
161        pool.sort();
162
163        int ret = 0;
164        for (int i = pool.size - 1, r = 0;  r < rolls && i >= 0; i--, r++) {
165            ret += pool.get(i);
166        }
167        return ret;
168    }
169
170    /**
171     * Totals the lowest n numbers in the pool.
172     *
173     * @param n the number of dice to be totaled
174     * @param pool the dice to pick from
175     * @return the sum
176     */
177    private int worstOf(int n, IntVLA pool) {
178        int rolls = Math.min(n, pool.size);
179        pool.sort();
180
181        int ret = 0;
182        for (int r = 0;  r < rolls; r++) {
183            ret += pool.get(r);
184        }
185        return ret;
186    }
187
188    /**
189     * Find the best n totals from the provided number of dice rolled according
190     * to the roll group string.
191     *
192     * @param n number of roll groups to total
193     * @param dice number of roll groups to roll
194     * @param group string encoded roll grouping
195     * @return the sum
196     */
197    public int bestOf(int n, int dice, String group) {
198        int rolls = Math.min(n, dice);
199        temp.clear();
200
201        for (int i = 0; i < dice; i++) {
202            temp.add(roll(group));
203        }
204
205        return bestOf(rolls, temp);
206    }
207
208    /**
209     * Find the worst n totals from the provided number of dice rolled according
210     * to the roll group string.
211     *
212     * @param n number of roll groups to total
213     * @param dice number of roll groups to roll
214     * @param group string encoded roll grouping
215     * @return the sum
216     */
217    public int worstOf(int n, int dice, String group) {
218        int rolls = Math.min(n, dice);
219        temp.clear();
220
221        for (int i = 0; i < dice; i++) {
222            temp.add(roll(group));
223        }
224
225        return worstOf(rolls, temp);
226    }
227
228    /**
229     * Emulate a dice roll and return the sum.
230     *
231     * @param n number of dice to sum
232     * @param sides positive integer; number of sides on the rolled dice
233     * @return sum of rolled dice
234     */
235    public int rollDice(int n, int sides) {
236        int ret = 0;
237        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
238            ret += rng.nextInt(sides) + 1;
239        }
240        return ret;
241    }
242
243    /**
244     * Emulate an exploding dice roll and return the sum.
245     *
246     * @param n number of dice to sum
247     * @param sides number of sides on the rollDice; should be greater than 1
248     * @return sum of rollDice
249     */
250    public int rollExplodingDice(int n, int sides) {
251        int ret = 0, curr;
252        if(sides <= 1) return n; // avoid infinite loop, act like they can't explode
253        for (int i = 0; i < n;) {
254            ret += (curr = rng.nextInt(sides) + 1);
255            if(curr != sides) i++;
256        }
257        return ret;
258    }
259
260    /**
261     * Get a list of the independent results of n rolls of dice with the given
262     * number of sides.
263     *
264     * @param n number of dice used
265     * @param sides positive integer; number of sides on each die
266     * @return list of results
267     */
268    public IntVLA independentRolls(int n, int sides) {
269        IntVLA ret = new IntVLA(n);
270        for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
271            ret.add(rng.nextInt(sides) + 1);
272        }
273        return ret;
274    }
275
276    /**
277     * Evaluate the String {@code rollCode} as dice roll notation and roll to get a random result of that dice roll.
278     * This is the main way of using the Dice class. This effectively allows rolling one or more dice and performing
279     * certain operations on the dice and their result. One of the more frequent uses is rolling some amount of dice and
280     * summing their values, which can be done with e.g. "4d10" to roll four ten-sided dice and add up their results.
281     * You can choose to sum only some of the dice, either the "n highest" or "n lowest" values in a group, with "3&gt;4d6"
282     * to sum the three greatest-value dice in four rolls of six-sided dice, or "2&lt;3d8" to sum the two lowest-value dice
283     * in three rolls of eight-sided dice. You can apply modifiers to these results, such as "1d20+7" to roll one
284     * twenty-sided die and add 7 to its result. These modifiers can be other dice, such as "1d10-1d6", and while
285     * multiplication and division are supported, order of operations isn't, so it just rolls dice from left to right
286     * and applies operators it find along the way. You can get a random value in an inclusive range with "50:100",
287     * which is equivalent to "1d51+49" but is easier to read and understand. You can treat dice as "exploding,"
288     * where any dice that get the maximum result are rolled again and added to the total along with the previous
289     * maximum result. As an example, if two exploding six-sided dice are rolled, and their results are 3 and 6, then
290     * because 6 is the maximum value it is rolled again and added to the earlier rolls; if the additional roll is a 5,
291     * then the sum is 3 + 6 + 5 (for a total of 14), but if the additional roll was a 6, then it would be rolled again
292     * and added again, potentially many times if 6 is rolled continually. Some players may be familiar with this game
293     * mechanic from various tabletop games, but many potential players might not be, so it should be explained if you
294     * show the kinds of dice being rolled to players. The syntax used for exploding dice replaced the "d" in "3d6" for
295     * normal dice with "!", making "3!6" for exploding dice. Inclusive ranges are not supported with best-of and
296     * worst-of notation, but exploding dice are. If using a range, the upper bound can be random, decided by dice rolls
297     * such as with "1:6d6" (which rolls six 6-sided dice and uses that as the upper bound of the range) or by other
298     * ranges such as with "10:100:200", which gets a random number between 100 and 200, then returns a random number
299     * between 10 and that. While it is technically allowed to end a dice string with an operator, the partial
300     * operator will be ignored. If you start a dice string with an operator, its left-hand-side will always be 0. If
301     * you have two operators in a row, only the last will be used, unless one is '-' and can be treated as part of a
302     * negative number (this allows "1d20 * -3" to work). Whitespace is allowed between most parts of a dice string.
303     * <br>
304     * The following notation is supported:
305     * <ul>
306     *     <li>{@code 42} : simple absolute string; can start with {@code -} to make it negative</li>
307     *     <li>{@code 3d6} : sum of 3 6-sided dice</li>
308     *     <li>{@code d6} : synonym for {@code 1d6}</li>
309     *     <li>{@code 3>4d6} : best 3 of 4 6-sided dice</li>
310     *     <li>{@code 3:4d6} : gets a random value between 3 and a roll of {@code 4d6}; this syntax has changed</li>
311     *     <li>{@code 2<5d6} : worst 2 of 5 6-sided dice</li>
312     *     <li>{@code 10:20} : simple random range (inclusive between 10 and 20)</li>
313     *     <li>{@code :20} : synonym for {@code 0:20}</li>
314     *     <li>{@code 3!6} : sum of 3 "exploding" 6-sided dice; see above for the semantics of "exploding" dice</li>
315     *     <li>{@code !6} : synonym for {@code 1!6}</li>
316     * </ul>
317     * The following types of operators are supported:
318     * <ul>
319     *     <li>{@code +4} : add 4 to the value</li>
320     *     <li>{@code -3} : subtract 3 from the value</li>
321     *     <li>{@code *100} : multiply value by 100</li>
322     *     <li>{@code /8} : integer-divide value by 8</li>
323     * </ul>
324     * @param rollCode dice string using the above notation
325     * @return a random number that is possible with the given dice string
326     */
327    public int roll(String rollCode) {
328        mat.setTarget(rollCode);
329        int ret, prev = 0;
330        char currentMode = '+';
331        while (mat.find()) {
332            ret = 0;
333            String num1 = mat.group(1); // number constant
334            String wmode = mat.group(2); // between notation
335            String wnum = mat.group(3); // number constant
336            String mode = mat.group(4); // dice, range, or explode
337            String num2 = mat.group(5); // number constant
338            String pmode = mat.group(6); // math operation
339
340            if(pmode != null)
341            {
342                currentMode = pmode.charAt(0);
343                continue;
344            }
345            int a = num1 == null ? 0 : StringKit.intFromDec(num1);
346            int b = num2 == null ? 0 : StringKit.intFromDec(num2);
347            int w = wnum == null ? 0 : StringKit.intFromDec(wnum);
348
349            if (num1 != null && num2 != null) {
350                if (wnum != null) {
351                    if (">".equals(wmode)) {
352                        if ("d".equals(mode)) {
353                            ret = bestOf(a, w, b);
354                        }
355                        else if("!".equals(mode))
356                        {
357                            ret = bestOfExploding(a, w, b);
358                        }
359                    }
360                    else if("<".equals(wmode))
361                    {
362                        if ("d".equals(mode)) {
363                            ret = worstOf(a, w, b);
364                        }
365                        else if("!".equals(mode))
366                        {
367                            ret = worstOfExploding(a, w, b);
368                        }
369                    }
370                    else
371                    // Here, wmode is ":", there is a constant lower bound for the range, and the upper bound is some
372                    // dice roll or other range. This can be negative, easily, if the random upper bound is negative
373                    {
374                        if ("d".equals(mode)) {
375                            ret = a + rng.nextSignedInt(rollDice(w, b) + 1 - a);
376                        } else if ("!".equals(mode)) {
377                            ret = a + rng.nextSignedInt(rollExplodingDice(w, b) + 1 - a);
378                        } else if (":".equals(mode)) {
379                            ret = a + rng.nextSignedInt(w + rng.nextSignedInt(b + 1 - w) + 1 - a);
380                        }
381                    }
382                } else if ("d".equals(mode)) {
383                    ret = rollDice(a, b);
384                } else if ("!".equals(mode)) {
385                    ret = rollExplodingDice(a, b);
386                } else if (":".equals(mode)) {
387                    ret = a + rng.nextSignedInt(b + 1 - a);
388                }
389            } else if (num1 != null) {
390                if (":".equals(wmode)) {
391                    ret = a + rng.nextSignedInt(w + 1 - a);
392                } else {
393                    ret = a;
394                }
395            } else if (num2 != null) {
396                if (mode != null) {
397                    switch (mode) {
398                        case "d":
399                            ret = rollDice(1, b);
400                            break;
401                        case "!":
402                            ret = rollExplodingDice(1, b);
403                            break;
404                        case ":":
405                            ret = rng.nextSignedInt(b + 1);
406                            break;
407                    }
408                }
409            }
410            switch (currentMode)
411            {
412                case '-':
413                    prev -= ret;
414                    break;
415                case '*':
416                    prev *= ret;
417                    break;
418                case '/':
419                    prev /= ret;
420                    break;
421                default:
422                    prev += ret;
423                    break;
424            }
425            currentMode = '+';
426        }
427        return prev;
428    }
429
430    /**
431     * Parses the given dice roll notation in {@code rollCode} and returns the data needed to perform that roll, as an
432     * IntVLA called a roll rule here. You can roll such a roll rule with {@link #runRollRule(IntVLA)}, any number of
433     * times, and get different results on different rolls even with the same rule. This saves time spent and garbage
434     * produced parsing the roll code for each roll with {@link #roll(String)}.
435     * @param rollCode a String or other CharSequence holding dice roll notation, like "3d8+5" (see {@link #roll(String)})
436     * @return {@code into}, after the roll rule has been appended
437     */
438    public IntVLA parseRollRule(CharSequence rollCode) {
439        return parseRollRuleInto(new IntVLA(), rollCode);
440    }
441    /**
442     * Parses the given dice roll notation in {@code rollCode} and puts out the data needed to perform that roll into
443     * {@code into}, where {@code into} is usually an empty IntVLA, and is called a roll rule here. You can roll such a
444     * roll rule with {@link #runRollRule(IntVLA)}, any number of times, and get different results on different rolls
445     * even with the same rule. This saves time spent and garbage produced parsing the roll code for each roll with
446     * {@link #roll(String)}.
447     * @param into a usually-empty IntVLA that will have a roll rule appended to its contents
448     * @param rollCode a String or other CharSequence holding dice roll notation, like "3d8+5" (see {@link #roll(String)})
449     * @return {@code into}, after the roll rule has been appended
450     */
451    public IntVLA parseRollRuleInto(IntVLA into, CharSequence rollCode){
452        mat2.setTarget(rollCode);
453        int op = mat2.pattern().groupId("op");
454        int sn = mat2.pattern().groupId("sn");
455        int im = mat2.pattern().groupId("im");
456        int mn = mat2.pattern().groupId("mn");
457        int mm = mat2.pattern().groupId("mm");
458        int en = mat2.pattern().groupId("en");
459        boolean starting = true;
460        while (mat2.find()) {
461            System.out.println(mat2.group());
462            if(starting && !mat2.isCaptured(op)){
463                into.add('+');
464                starting = false;
465            }
466            if(mat2.isCaptured("op")) // math op
467            {
468                into.add(mat2.charAt(0, op)); // gets char 0 from the math op group
469                starting = false;
470            }
471
472            boolean startNum = mat2.isCaptured(sn); // number constant
473            int initialMode = mat2.isCaptured(im) ? mat2.charAt(0, im) : 0; // between, best, or worst notation
474            boolean midNum = mat2.isCaptured(mn); // number constant
475            int mainMode = mat2.isCaptured(mm) ? mat2.charAt(0, mm) : 0; // dice, range, or explode
476            boolean endNum = mat2.isCaptured(en); // number constant
477            if(!(startNum || midNum || endNum))
478                break;
479            int startN = startNum ? StringKit.intFromDec(rollCode, mat2.start(sn), mat2.end(sn)) : 0;
480            int midN = midNum ? StringKit.intFromDec(rollCode, mat2.start(mn), mat2.end(mn)) : 0;
481            if(!startNum && endNum && mainMode != ':')
482                midN = 1;
483            int endN = endNum ? StringKit.intFromDec(rollCode, mat2.start(en), mat2.end(en)) : 0;
484
485            into.add(startN);
486            into.add(initialMode);
487            into.add(midN);
488            into.add(mainMode);
489            into.add(endN);
490        }
491        return into;
492    }
493
494    /**
495     * Attempts to run the given roll rule stored in the given IntVLA, returning the result as if rolling the dice as it
496     * describes. You can use {@link #parseRollRule(CharSequence)} or {@link #parseRollRuleInto(IntVLA, CharSequence)}
497     * to get such a roll rule.
498     * @param rollRule an IntVLA as returned by {@link #parseRollRule(CharSequence)} or {@link #parseRollRuleInto(IntVLA, CharSequence)}
499     * @return the result of one roll of the given rule
500     */
501    public int runRollRule(IntVLA rollRule) {
502        if(rollRule == null || rollRule.isEmpty()) return 0;
503        int currentResult, previousTotal = 0;
504        for (int i = 0; i < rollRule.size; i+=6) {
505            int currentMode = rollRule.get(i);
506            currentResult = 0;
507
508
509            int startN = rollRule.get(i+1); // number constant
510            int midMode = rollRule.get(i+2); // between notation
511            int midN = rollRule.get(i+3); // number constant
512            int mainMode = rollRule.get(i+4); // dice, range, or explode
513            int endN = rollRule.get(i+5); // number constant
514
515            if (mainMode != 0) {
516                if (midMode != 0) {
517                    if ('>' == midMode) {
518                        if ('d' == (mainMode)) {
519                            currentResult = bestOf(startN, midN, endN);
520                        }
521                        else if('!' == (mainMode))
522                        {
523                            currentResult = bestOfExploding(startN, midN, endN);
524                        }
525                    }
526                    else if('<' == midMode)
527                    {
528                        if ('d' == (mainMode)) {
529                            currentResult = worstOf(startN, midN, endN);
530                        }
531                        else if('!' == (mainMode))
532                        {
533                            currentResult = worstOfExploding(startN, midN, endN);
534                        }
535                    }
536                    else
537                    // Here, midMode is ":", there is a constant lower bound for the range, and the upper bound is some
538                    // dice roll or other range. This can be negative, easily, if the random upper bound is negative
539                    {
540                        if ('d' == (mainMode)) {
541                            currentResult = startN + rng.nextSignedInt(rollDice(midN, endN) + 1 - startN);
542                        } else if ('!' == (mainMode)) {
543                            currentResult = startN + rng.nextSignedInt(rollExplodingDice(midN, endN) + 1 - startN);
544                        } else if (':' == (mainMode)) {
545                            currentResult = startN + rng.nextSignedInt(midN + rng.nextSignedInt(endN + 1 - midN) + 1 - startN);
546                        }
547                    }
548                } else if ('d' == (mainMode)) {
549                    currentResult = rollDice(startN, endN);
550                } else if ('!' == (mainMode)) {
551                    currentResult = rollExplodingDice(startN, endN);
552                } else if (':' == (mainMode)) {
553                    currentResult = startN + rng.nextSignedInt(endN + 1 - startN);
554                }
555            } else {
556                if (':' == (midMode)) {
557                    currentResult = startN + rng.nextSignedInt(midN + 1 - startN);
558                } else {
559                    currentResult = startN;
560                }
561            }
562            switch (currentMode)
563            {
564                case '-':
565                    previousTotal -= currentResult;
566                    break;
567                case '*':
568                    previousTotal *= currentResult;
569                    break;
570                case '/':
571                    previousTotal /= currentResult;
572                    break;
573                default:
574                    previousTotal += currentResult;
575                    break;
576            }
577        }
578        return previousTotal;
579    }
580}
